question: Is collagen the most abundant human protein?
ideal_answer: Yes, collagen is the most abundant protein family in mammals.

snippets.text: As the most abundant protein in the body, collagen is essential to maintain the normal structure and strength of connective tissue, such as bones, skin, cartilage, and blood vessels.
Collagen is the most abundant protein family in mammals.

Collagen is a fibrillar protein that conforms the conjunctive and connective tissues in the human body, essentially skin, joints, and bones. This molecule is one of the most abundant in many of the living organisms due to its connective role in biological structures.
